title: Introduction to C
subject: C Programming
theory:
**C** is a general-purpose, procedural computer programming language supporting structured programming, lexical variable scope, and recursion. 
Developed by **Dennis Ritchie** at Bell Labs in 1972. 
It is the 'Mother of all languages' (C++, Java, Python borrow syntax from C).

common_mistakes.correction: C powers Windows, Linux, Mac, Android, and iOS kernels. It is immortal.

interview_questions.question: Why is C called a Middle-Level Language?
interview_questions.answer: It combines high-level features (functions, english syntax) with low-level capabilities (memory access, pointers).

exam_notes: Developed to rewrite UNIX operating system.
